{a kadir jasin} esteemed debaters and visitor,1. those of us who are malaysians and care about our country, have to make greater efforts to understand the "new china".2. it is hard to assume that neither najib nor zahid is unware of china’s expansionary policy.3. if they do not, i hope our defence experts and military leadership do because some of the things that najib and zahid are doing today could make us an easy target of china’s new defence doctrine.4. a chinese defense white paper released on 26 may 2015, among other things, outlined a new military strategy that emphasizes a more “active defense posture” and a greater chinese naval presence farther from china’s shores.5. it was the ninth such paper to be published since 1998, but the first to focus exclusively on strategy.6. the principal doctrine of the chinese military appears to be unaltered: winning local wars under conditions of informationization. thus, network-centric warfare and the growing informatization of the battlefield are seen as particularly important for the pla’s “preparation for military struggle (pms).”7. “the world revolution in military affairs (rma) is proceeding to a new stage. long-range, precise, smart, stealthy and unmanned weapons and equipment are becoming increasingly sophisticated. outer space and cyber space have become new commanding heights in strategic competition among all parties,” the paper notes.8. with the tensions in the north and south china over territorial claims, the doctrine places a premium on maritime combat readiness. it says:in line with the evolving form of war and national security situation, the basic point for pms will be placed on winning informationized local wars, highlighting maritime military struggle and maritime pms. 9. the paper speaks about china’s aspirations towards a blue-water navy and an increased chinese naval presence outside territorial waters:in line with the strategic requirement of offshore waters defense and open seas protection, the pla navy (plan) will gradually shift its focus from “offshore waters defense” to the combination of “offshore waters defense” with “open seas protection,” and build a combined, multi-functional and efficient marine combat force structure. the plan will enhance its capabilities for strategic deterrence and counterattack, maritime maneuvers, joint operations at sea, comprehensive defense and comprehensive support.10. unless we are stupid or have sold our souls to china we must not discount the likelihood of china using all possible means, including economic enslavement and espionage, to neutralise its neighbours.11. buying chinese military equipment and border surveillance equipment increases china’s foothold in our country. and having hundreds of thousands chinese visiting, studying, working and staying in malaysia makes its preparation for military struggle (pms) easier.wallahuaklam.

{zalman a} in october 2016 president of the mca, datuk seri liow tiong lai, said that the opposition's desire to ensure a straight fight against barisan nasional is just "empty talk". he was quoted as saying that members of the opposition coalition have big differences between each other and this will lead to them fighting each other.liow is exactly right. the opposition coalition has no clear leader today and their leaders send conflicting messages to the public. since the break up of pakatan rakyat, and despite the formation of the new pakatan harapan, they have not been able to come up with a coherent and unified policy platform. that may very well lead to multi-cornered fights, just as liow predicted.the weakest point for pakatan harapan is when they are asked to name their candidate for prime minister. the answers that they have given so far has been weak and unconvincing.one side of pakatan wants to have datuk seri anwar ibrahim as the prime minister. in their desperation to show loyalty to anwar, some pakatan leaders have suggested that once they win, they will get anwar to be pardoned by the agong so that he can contest and eventually become prime minister. for this to happen, they also suggest that datin seri wan azizah should be appointed as interim prime minister, warming up the seat until her husband is freed.there is another group who wants pakatan to move beyond anwar. they are not saying anwar should be forgotten. but they feel we cannot have a puppet interim prime minister. the premiership is not something that can be tossed around between husband and wife as thy wish. hence they insist that someone else should be named as pakatan's candidate for prime minister. several names have been proposed, including tan sri muhyiddin yassin.there is also another group who simply wants to avoid the issue altogether. they found it too difficult to give a straight answer, and, rather than working it out, they skirt the issue. as an excuse they claim that it is too early to think about who will become prime minister because, according to them, pakatan should focus on issues that are more important to the people.in short, pakatan is so divided and they can't even unite on one of the most fundamental questions that any rational voter would ask. surely pakatan leaders realise that the whole country is asking the question.

{zalman a} liow was obviously comparing pakatan to barisan nasional and that is where he went wrong. he thought barisan nasional is a "united" coalition. that is false. barisan nasional is not united as such. they are merely subservient.barisan nasional today has become a coalition of many irrelevant parties dictated by one supreme overlord. they are no longer equals. the big brother is free to entertain or ignore other minions as they wish.for example, when chinese schools were having difficulty to access their funding recently, liow was only able to say that he will "follow up" with the prime minister on this issue.worse, mca's senator chong sin woon who is also deputy minister of education was reported to say "mca insists that chinese primary schools should receive the full allocation."when a deputy minister can only "insist", and a full minister can only "follow up", you know how influential the party is.of course the mca may eventually get the money but the rule remains, namely, mca can beg but they must obey. if they disagree with a decision, all they can do is just "insist" and "follow up". the relationship in barisan nasional is more like a master and a servant, not a relationship between equals.i personally do not like the policies that was offered by the previous pakatan rakyat and i suspect many of the policies that will be offered by pakatan harapan will follow the same streak. but when it comes to the way the coalition is managed, i still prefer the division and disunity of pakatan.they are a coalition of equals, and when everyone is equal, unity is not easy to get because there is no big brother. no one party is more supreme than the other. if any component party has an idea or a suggestion, they must propose, persuade and win the public debate rather than bulldoze it through. that is a much more democratic and unauthoritarian way of making decisions.wan saiful, ideas

{zalman a}  hari ini, tidak lagi mampu membayar dividen seperti dahulu2 dalam belasan peratus. hari ini terpaksa jual asset satu demi satu untuk terus membayar dividen. jika tidak, mereka yang dahulu bersetuju memindahkan share kpf kepada fgv akan terdedah menjadi ejen dan barua isa samad dan najib razak. duit rm2.2 billion mungkin telah lesap. yang boleh ditunjukkan oleh kpf ialah ladang sawit di sarawak yang terpaksa ada kos nya. mengapa kpf tidak buka ladang ala felda disana jika sudah ada ladang besar?disini bising sangat hendak buka ladang untuk jenerasi ke2.ini  patut jadi bisnes model nya- kpf beli ladang besar dan buka estet ala felda. jika kpf membeli, maka tanah2 kerajaan yang percuma itu, boleh di mohon oleh anak2 bangsa yang bukan jenerasi ke2 atau ke3 felda.  kesian lah kepada anak kampong tradisional dan orang melayu yang miskin dalam bandar.sekarang nasi sudah jadi bubur. apabila kamu menyediakan tempat tidur, maka terpaksalah kamu yang tidur diatas nya. kpf sudah tidak ada dan wang mengurang. lama kelamaan kpf akan hilang semua.jika pengurusan kpf dilakukan oleh puak peneroka sendiri, ingat lah najib tidak memandang kamu sebagai ada potensi. itulah sebab nya kpf ditendang keluar dari fgv. dia tahu kpf akan jahanam. persepsi najib keatas kpf sebegini adalah penghinaan keatas peneroka sendiri. tapi peneroka kata tidak mengapa. durian runtuh ada. tahun ini dengar nya lagi banyak. sebagai umpan pilihanraya. orang felda jual anak dan bini pun tidak mengapa. tujuan isa hendak jadi pengerusi kpf ialah untuk menguasai duit yang ada berbilion ringgit dalam akaun kpf. bila proksi nya dilantik, ada terma dalam perlantikan itu yang menyebut bahawa pegerusi kpf ada hak untuk membuat keputusan mengenai pelaburan atau perbelanjaan sebagai kata pemutus.peneroka tidak nampak bahawa isa samad letak proxy dalam kpf. dia ada hak membuat keputusan akhir. kpf baru sahaja mendapat rm2.2 bilion sebagai imbuhan menyerahkan 51% share nya dalam felda holdings. tapi isa mahu meletakkan tangan kotornya keatas wang tesebut.jadi apa yang diperlakukan keatas rm2.2 billion tersebut? ada sebuah ladang sawit di sarawak yang sudah berada agak lama dalam pasaran; harga nya antara rm750-800 juta. tapi pengerusi kpf memutuskan untuk membeli ladang tersebut sebanyak rm1.2 bllion- kira2 rm400 juta tambahan.

{zalman a} institutional failure and lack of accountability are not limited to 1mdb. year after year, the auditor general has revealed staggering cases of mismanaged public funds. government bodies bought wall clocks at rm 3,810 a piece (the market price is easily below rm 100) and scanners for rm 14,670 (market price: rm 200). the “normalization of corruption” is deeply embedded in the existing hierarchy, from the top to the bottom. in the newly released report, the auditors found that the federal land development authority (felda) lost hundreds of millions due to multiple transactions without proper authorization, dubious planning and execution, and complete mismanagement. it made news for two to three days before disappearing, like pretty much every other scandal. corrupt acts are committed and revealed, followed by public outrage. but with no institution to exercise accountability, the news eventually disappears. it has become a normal cycle.the by-elections last year might provide some hint as to how the general elections will turn out. najib’s coalition won both of them. i was in the suburban areas when opposition parties held a town hall panel session, inevitably speaking in english, touching on issues such as the removal of the attorney general. while these are big, national issues, it felt out of place. there is a visible gap between the politicians, the city folks, the demonstrators who so urgently and desperately want reforms, and the voters outside the cities, who voted for candidates affiliated to najib’s party.to speak plainly, people don’t mind the status quo as long as they are not affected at the most immediate and personal level. the whole 1mdb scandal has been too complicated to be explained to non-english literate voters with no understanding of the complex technical terms, in a five-minute rally,. financial scandals grow more complicated and people just lose interest. maybe they underestimate the cost of it all, maybe they don’t care enough or just don’t lose enough; either way they are not angry enough to want to change the status quo.http://thediplomat.com/

{hihwag} time magazine.....todayshe gave her speech from her dining room, which also functions as her newsroom. it is here that she runs sarawak report, a nearly seven-year-old investigative news website. sixteen months earlier, in july 2015, she had published a bombshell of a report: the personal bank accounts of malaysian prime minister najib razak, she alleged, held nearly $700 million tied to state fund 1malaysia development berhad (1mdb).“i want to say first how sorry i am not to be able to join you in singapore as planned,” rewcastle brown, 57, told the crowd nearly 13,000 km away. her audience, comprising mostly executives and auditors, was rapt. “the loss is entirely mine as it was a huge opportunity for me to meet with so many people of expertise in financial fraud — where i have been stumbling along as a jobbing journalist.”“so, where do i fit as a mere reporter into this juggernaut of a story?” she asked the crowd. “you can hardly expect me not to take advantage of this platform you have kindly provided me with, to put in a plea for the vital role of journalism and free media in exposing corruption that threatens to undermine all our democratic systems.”rewcastle brown’s british penchant for understatement is deceptive. the 1mdb controversy uncovered by this “mere reporter” is the biggest corruption scandal in recent memory to involve a head of government, in terms of both the sum of money involved and the magnitude of the sensational news story it has become. rewcastle brown is, as abraham lincoln apocryphally said of the antislavery author harriet beecher stowe, “the little lady who wrote the book that started this great war.”

{keluarga felda dari seberang.} salam datuk akj:sewaktu tertubuhnya bw plantation tbk/bwp di di kuasai oleh tjipto widodo pada tahun 1998(jika tak silap saya,ladang masih kecil kira 700hecter(zaman itu financial crisis)tjipto widodo besarkan perusahan tersebut pada tahun 2002 bersama halim ashari(warga negara malaysia yg ada pengalaman di bousted),halim dilantik sbg president director dan widodo adalah presiden komisaris.hasilnya memberangsangkan.pada tahun 2009 peter sondakh melirik bw plantation(barangkali md nya org malaysia dan juga ada saham besar di bw).peter sondakh/ps melihat ini peluang terbaik kerna ps terkenal sbg seorg beli jual perusahaan.ps tersenarai org ke 8 terkaya di indonesia setelah sepak terajangnya dalam penjualan pt excel indo kpd telekom malaysia dan mula bangunkan empirenya dimalaysia hasil keakraban beliau dgn najib(agaknya najib yg jadikan ps tersenarai ke8 terkaya di indonesia).halim ashari melepaskan saham beliau di bw plantation pada tahun 2014-2015.dari situ ps tidak perlu memikirkan jaya atau tidak bw plantation kedepan(ada 2 syarikat yg bawa bw plantation ke mahkamah kerna hutang tertunggak tapi telah di selesai di luar pengadilan/mahkamah).bagi ps beli bw dalam tempoh 5 bln 15 hari dan tawarkan pada fgv,kemudian felda dan terakhir pic/ anak perusahaan felda.ps sondakh buat 'instant cash'saperti juga  moto 'cash is king'.modus buat intant cash diulang tayang oleh ps sama saperti penjualan pt excel pada telekom.ps jadi lagi kaya sekarang hasil 2nd offer pada malaysia kerna hanya dengan panggilan telepon transaksi berjaya kedua berjaya,tiada yg boleh halang,kerana moto cash is king dan kuasa di tangan gue(aku).ps bertambah kaya,sahabt di malaysia bertambah uang,yg jual saham pada ps dah duduk goyang kaki di bumi garuda.salam semua

{hihwag} najib has continued to use his billions to pay local supporters, as leaked evidence from his bank accounts shows.numerous cheques have been drawn from his slush funds to individuals from his party – the office holders whose votes support his continuing position in power.  in return, these individuals have chosen to believe najib’s excuses for his money, including his explanation that it came from a small time royal from saudi arabia, (one abdulaziz al saud, who has connections with petrosaudi).  najib says it was abdulaziz who passed him the $681 million dollars as a “donation”, plus the many other earlier payments into his account – including a further $170 million paid in november 2011 from src. he also claims that he returned most of the money via tanore, although the doj say the money was traced to laundering in the states.malaysia’s ruling elite is therefore entering 2017 entrenched in this corrupt collaboration with a leader, who has stolen the money they are enjoying from the public purse.as the economy groans and foreign investor confidence evaporates, this group are clearly further planning to squeeze one last dollop from malaysia’s public funds. yet another $680 million is the payment being offered by felda to buy out eagle plantations from najib’s close friend the indonesian businessman peter sondakh in a blatant further deal to pad out umno’s pre-election purse at the expense of malaysia’s poorest farmers.the logic is that if najib can manage to again buy the next election he will at last be able to put behind him the scandal that after two years has refused to go away, ignore the foreign critics and be safe from justice at last.will he succeed?the answer will come in 2017…. probably.

{taosuo} on the sidelines, there appeared to be some low level "friendly fire" between kak wan and dr mahathir on whether brim handouts is bribery or not.in islam, the key word is intention or 'niat'. if the money from the government's coffers is intended to buy support from the dreadfully poor, and the recipient feels obligated and do vote the bn as per the dogma "you help me and i help you"...then it is certainly bribery.on the other hand, if the recipient takes the money, sniffed a stench of possible buying of votes, and to affirm and register his/her repugnance and contempt for such endeavours, goes and votes for the opposition, then he is certainly not party.the bn expectedly is of course pleading good intentions but from my observations, this time around, not many are buying it.

{taosuo} on the sidelines, there appeared to be some low level "friendly fire" between kak wan(pkr) and dr mahathir on whether brim handouts is bribery or not.in islam, the key word is intention or 'niat'. if the money from the government's coffers is intended to buy support from the dreadfully and desperately poor, and the not so poor, and the recipient feels obligated or beholden and do vote the bn as per the dogma "you help me and i help you"...then it is certainly bribery.on the other hand, if the recipient takes the money, sniffed a stench of possible vote buying and to affirm and register his/her repugnance and contempt for such endeavours, goes and votes for the opposition, then he/she is certainly not party.the bn expectedly is of course protesting good intentions but from my observations, this time around, not many are buying it. yet, targeted groups like felda settlers, some urban poor, the 'civil' service, village apparat including mosque officials, including from sabah and sarawak  etc may be coming in for further special 'considerations'... for which some of the anti corruption people is expected to not give a damn.

{hihwag} there is really no evidence that the opposition can overthrow this kleptocratic regime or if the variables mentioned in the articles would fall into place, thereby facilitating a harapan victory.this is not meant as an attack but rather a rejoinder that we are sailing through very dangerous waters and if we do not get our act together and move beyond simply cheerleading a disorganised opposition, we could end up in a whole world of hurt.1) umno has always suffered electoral setbacks when faced with a cohesive opposition. as it is, the opposition is in disarray. pas is a spoiler made worse by the reality that pkr needs them to remain politically relevant.2) recent by elections have demonstrated that bersatu or at least the personalities behind them and amanah have not gained traction with the demographic that keeps umno in power.3) the issue of corruption plays well with the urban demographic but again for various reasons has not become an issue with rural demographic. if umno delivers everything it says it will deliver, the cycle of complicity will continue. disenfranchised people will continue voting for a regime which puts rice in their bowls. i am not talking about the urban class but rather those people who have depended on real power, federal power exercised corruptly for their benefit. that is the culture some people forget that we are dealing with. we nurtured this culture.4) felda settlers unfortunately are not easily moved by corruption scandals only because they have weathered such scandals over the long umno watch. if the najib regime can find a way to assuage their grievances, then they will remain firmly in the umno camp. and since umno has always found a way to placate this demographic and keep a tight lid on anyone attempting to proselytise to them, i do not think that banking on them would be beneficial to harapan.5) the younger generation of malay voters are a promising demographic but they are currently embroiled in a culture war that consumes most of their energy and effort.young malay oppositional types not only have to contend with the umno regime but they also have to contend with the islamic forces in this country with no help whatsoever from mainstream malay political parties or non-malay political parties who do not view them as part of a new deal but merely a specific racial demographic needed to win the throne of putrajaya.6) race and religion. while my views on these issues are spread across various articles, i think there are deeper issues here than just umno spreading racial and religious discord. i think that umno is the main purveyor or racial and religious disharmony but i do think that what the opposition keeps running into a deep-rooted cultural and historical issues from within pakatan that they have not dealt with hence are not able to come up with a convincing strategy to win over the majority malay demographic.7) finally, the native voters of sabah and sarawak. i would not put much faith in them. they really do have problems that most peninsular malaysians have no idea of.

{zalman a} kuala lumpur (dec 23): datuk seri nazir razak, chairman of cimb group holdings bhd and younger brother of prime minister datuk seri najib razak, today questioned federal land development authority's (felda) acquisition of a 37% stake in indonesia's pt eagle high plantations tbk for us$505.4 million (rm2.26 billion).nazir posted a black-and-white photograph on his instagram this evening of his father — the late prime minister tun abdul razak hussein –  addressing a group of people, presumably early felda settlers.the photograph was uploaded on instagram together with the message: "felda announced buying 37% of eagle high for us$505m or 580 rupiah per share. eagle high's average price in november was 212 rupiah per share, so a 173% premium for a non-control stake. i hope the board will fully justify the acquisition & valuation even though the deal is no longer made by listed fgv (felda global ventures bhd)."garnering 173 “likes” at the time of writing, one of nazir’s followers wrote, "pity to the settlers. felda no longer looking after the poor but only serve the elites."datuk,we are going to see the complete breakdown of governance if mo1 is around for much longer.if you steal once, you will steal again.he is becoming reckless and shameless.i hear a mega-dose of dedak is being prepared by the gomen for the oghang felda, so that they do not do anything rational next year, such as vote against the bugis thief.we must learn as a nation that accepting short term rewards but prolonging corruption is not worth it.if the robber takes rm10,000 from your house and then places rm500 of it on your doorstep, there is no reason to be thankful.but that is how we think.that is why br1m (bribe rakyat 1mappadulung) still "works".

{sukasamasuka} datuk,"sogokan ini adalah pengakuan mutakhir najib dan konco-konco beliau bahawa umno/bn bukan lagi pilihan eksklusif di rancangan-rancangan felda, khususnya dan di kawasan luar bandar, amnya."- bagi 25,000+ warga felda yang datang ke putrajaya untuk menghadiri jamuan dan perayaan felda settlers day 2017, mereka nampak happy saja dapat durian runtuh nie.- mereka tak kisah duit datang dari mana datuk, janji kata mereka dapat itu duit.- datang ke pesta itu lagi la  seronok...semua kena tanggung...itu duit juga...juta2 ringgit juga tu...bila lagi, bukan senang jumpa pm.- najib baik...dia "giving a 2nd chance” to 17,679 peneroka yang keras kepala tak mau jual hasil pada felda...kesian melepas sikawan2 nie tak dapat duit...sabar bos ku, kalau bekerjasama dapat juga tu, tapi next year, feb 2018...ini signal pru14 bukan tahun ini...atau pun satu muslihat?- arwah kedua orang tua kami, moga2an roh mereka mendengar...selalu kasi nasihat masa kami kecik2 dulu..."jangan makan titik peluh orang, berdosa besar kalau dia tak halalkan".-  kepada semua 94,956 peneroka felda, tanpa kamu sedari kamu makan titik peluh orang lain...dosanya besar...tidak senang seumur hidup!- ini nasihat karut, jangan pakai.

{sukasamasuka} datuk," baguslah peneroka felda mendapat durian runtuh. tetapi siapa yang membiayainya? silap-silap peneroka sendiri yang berhutang untuk membiayai insentif itu."- bagi datuk, mungkin bagus...tapi, aku rasa, bukan itu yang tersirat dalam hati datuk.- sebenarnya aku jealous.- 94,956 peneroka felda yang setia tetap dapat duit undi awal, sedangkan aku habuk pun tarak.- mana tidaknya, peruntukan lebih dari rm1.5 bil (6 incentives felda) ini tadi, kita tidak tau dari mana sumbernya memandangkan felda mengalami rm1 bil deficit.- ini sikit kalau dibanding dengan reserve rm40 bil pnb...kalau bolih beli 25 nombor plat kereta, what is rm1.5 billion?...peanut!- dari mana pun sumber duit itu tadi, macam  juga duit 1mdb yang dipakai untuk naik haji...itu bukan duit titik peluh sendiri.- begini la bagaimana, (datuk seri i mappadulung daeng mattimung karaeng sandrobone sultan abdul jalil) mohd najib abdul razak, membangsatkan bangsanya sendiri...kerana mau kuasa.- aku undi umno pada pru13 dengan harapan kita dapat pemimpin yang baik...itu hak aku.- aku bukan undi umno supaya pemimpin haramzadah umno itu, suka suka pakai duit titik peluh rakyat dengan sewenang2nya...itu pecah amanah nama nya.- pada saat ini, semalam ada seorang muda, seorang cikgu yang mengajar ditempat jin bertandang...7 jam kereta masuk, jalan lumpur, minum/mandi air hujan, tiada elektik, tiada telefon...dia cerita, bahawa elaun kesusahan mereka sudah dipotong dari rm1,500 kepada rm1,000...peruntukan kertas a4 pun sudah tidak ada...nasib kamu baik ba di malaya, semua mewah...ini la sabah, tanah air ku!- tidak apa, kamu makan la itu titik peluh orang...kamu akan ditimpah balanya!...itu kan janjinya!kami orang2 tua yang sudah pencen ini...bagi pihak cikgu2 yang mengajar di pedalaman sabah...mana mana saja ba kalau kamu orang malaya!ini masa kamu....

support..............................."allowances for trainee teachers should not be abolished...july 27, 2017 by zairil khir johariyesterday, a coalition of 14 varsity organisations visited parliament to submit a memorandum protesting the government’s proposal to abolish living and travelling allowances currently provided to trainee teachers undergoing the bachelor of education undergraduate programme (program ijazah sarjana muda pendidikan, pismp) at teacher training institutes (institut pendidikan guru, ipg).as of now, trainee teachers enrolled in the pismp programme receive a monthly living allowance of rm430 and a maximum travel allowance of rm500. in fact, rm430 is already a reduced amount, as it used to range from rm500 to rm800 a month depending on location.in lieu of the allowances, national higher education fund corporation (perbadanan tabung pendidikan tinggi negara, ptptn) facilities will be made available for students at teacher training institutes in order for them to finance their cost of living throughout their four years of study.misplaced prioritiesonce again, the government appears prepared to sacrifice the future of our country in its attempt to cover its own wrongdoings. instead of addressing the rampant wastages, corruption and financial scandals that continue to drain the resources of our nation, the government prefers to punish critical sectors such as education.while education expenditure continues to command the bulk share of the government’s annual budget, its actual spending priorities are highly questionable. billions of ringgit have been exhausted on white elephant projects such as ytl’s 1bestarinet, while key items such as teacher development has seen its budget continuously slashed, dropping by half from rm1.5 billion in 2015 to rm763 million in 2017. even the allocation for english enhancement programmes have been reduced by two-thirds.unfortunately, while the much-vaunted malaysia education blueprint 2013-2025 pays lip service to the need to improve the quality of teachers, the government appears to be doing the exact opposite.scrap the proposalsthe government should immediately review its flawed proposal and scrap plans to abolish the living and travelling allowances of trainee teachers. if anything, the teaching profession should be further incentivised in order to attract better talents. if the quality of education in our schools is to be improved, then the quality of teachers has to be given the utmost priority.furthermore, it is even more outrageous to replace the allowances with ptptn loans in order for the trainees to support themselves. not only would this make the option of becoming a teacher less attractive, it would also add to the burdens of fresh graduate teachers who have already sacrificed much in taking up the mantle of their noble profession.zairil khir johari is bukit bendara mp, dap parliamentary spokesperson for education, science and technology.(1) http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/opinion/2017/07/27/allowances-for-trainee-teachers-should-not-be-abolished/

{sukasamasuka} datuk,"saya juga tidak peduli sangat kalau diri saya tidak dihiraukan oleh pengurusan atasan pnb."1. datuk adalah salah satu dari 13 juta pelabur dalam skim pnb...jadi datuk hanya ikan bilis saja la.2. kalau datuk akj macam ikan bilis dikacamata syarikat gergasi terkemuka macam pnb...yang kami2 ini, macam mana pula?3. pada mulanya saya memang rasa hairan kenapa masaalah dan komplain ikan2 bilis macam datuk tidak dapat sambutan dari pihak pengurusan pnb.4. besar kemungkinan, "roh" pnb dimasa lampau tidak sama dengan "roh" pnb sekarang...maklum saja la mungkin dimasa dulu pnb ini betul2 "melayu", tetapi sekarang sudah jadi "malayu"...tapi aku silap pula, bila aku buka website pnb...ini yang aku jumpa...5. http://www.pnb.com.my/about_m.phpnilai kamicompetence (kecekapan)kami mempunyai kecekapan yang perlu untuk mencapai prestasi tinggi.humility (rendah diri)kami sentiasa menghormati orang lain serta menjiwai asal usul dan perjuangan jitu pnb.integrity (integriti)kami sama sekali tidak akan berkompromi dalam hal integriti dan berpegang penuh kepadastandard etika yang tertinggi.prudence (cermat)kami sentiasa focus terhadap melindungi pelaburan pemegang unit amanah kami.passion (semangat)kami sentiasa bersemangat tinggi untuk mencorak pencapaian luar biasa. 6. apa ke nilai2 pnb ini hanya untuk siok dibaca olih ikan2 bilis saja?7. kami memohon pada 'pengurusan baru pnb' dibawah pimpinan tan sri wahid supaya kembali pada nilai2 asal, bukan untuk mengajar sesiapa, tetapi demi bangsa melayu.8. nilai2 ini la yang menyebabkan pnb jadi sebuah institusi melayu yang teragong bukan saja di malaysia tetapi diseluruh dunia.9. hayati la nilai2 ini...sebab pnb adalah benteng ekonomi melayu yang terakhir...yang masih berdiri teguh...masih bermoral.10. hancur melayu kalau pnb rosak!

{rd.} salam dato akj.bukan setakat dividen asb saja yang terendah dalam sejarah, dato. dividen asg (amanah saham gemilang) juga yang terendah dalam sejarah. berikut saya ambil dari 'laporan tahunan bagi tahun kewangan bertarikh 31 mac 2017' yang dihantar kepada saya, setiap tahun.(bermula tahun 2018, ia akan dihantar melalui elektronik, jika saya bersetuju).asg-pendidikan2015 = 7.102016 = 6.002017 = 4.50asg-kesihatan2015 = 7.202016 = 7.002017 = 4.25asg-persaraan2015 = 7.152016 = 6.802017 = 5.15baru-baru ini, kerana ada urusan lain berhampiran, saya telah pergi ke menara pnb jalan tun razak untuk melabur duit-raya anak-anak. sejak dari kecil lagi saya sudah membuka akaun asd (amanah saham didik) untuk anak-anak dan menjadi kelaziman setiap tahun saya akan 'merampas' sebahagian besar duit-raya mereka untuk dimasukkan dalam asd. saya isi borang dan beri passbook anak-anak di kaunter. juruwang terus memulangkan balik semua passbook kepada saya sambil berkata, 'buku tidak lagi diperlukan'. saya balas; 'kalau hilang pun tak apa la, ya?' dan juruwang jawab; 'ya, hilang pun tak apa'.saya bertanya lagi; 'kalau macam tu, bagaimana saya nak buktikan kepada anak-anak, bahawa semua duit-raya mereka telah saya masukan dalam asd?'juruwang jawab; 'nanti saya printkan transaksi pelaburan ini, sebagai bukti kepada mereka.'namun, saya tidak lagi boleh mengetahui jumlah baki dalam akaun tiga orang anak saya yang sudah mencapai umur 18 tahun. mereka mesti berdaftar sendiri dalam talian untuk mengetahui baki wang yang saya sendiri berikan pada mereka, sebagai duit-raya.ini bermakna, setelah mereka mencapai umur 18, saya tidak lagi dapat memantau samada mereka berbelanja boros untuk membeli barangan mewah yang tidak bermanafaat kepada kehidupan mereka sebagai pelajar di ipta/s.yang jelas, pada saya, pnb banyak dapat berjimat dengan 'langkah' elektronik ini. mungkin dengan jumlah yang dapat dijimatkan ini mereka rasa berhak membazir hampir setengah juta ringgit untuk nombor-palat kereta dan juga membeli kereta-baru. alangkah baik jika wang itu dikembalikankan kepada pelabur dalam bentuk dividen.terima kasih dato, kerana menceritakan mengenai "maybank ib mengakui yang ia telah membeli 17.1 juta saham lotte pada harga rm6.4718 sesaham dengan membayar rm110.67 juta. maybank ib adalah penasihat dan penjamin (underwriter) ipo lotte itu."kita juga kena 'berjaga-jaga' pada bulan november ini bila edra milik china, buat ipo.

{sukasamasuka} datuk,"saya pernah dengar ada agensi penyelarasan modal yang berasa sudah sampai masanya jaminan harga (price guarantee) skim amanah saham bumiputera (asb) dihapuskan dan skim pinjaman membeli saham asb ditamatkan. saya rasa saya tahu siapa pengkhianat ini."- ceritakan datuk...ceritakan siapa pengkhianat bangsa ini?- pada dasarnya, saya sendiri tidak berapa suka pasal skim2 pinjaman asb ini yang dipopularkan olih bank2 di malaysia sebab orang macam saya bukan besar pendapatan...kasi pagi makan pagi...jadi besar kemungkinan juga yang sebenarnya, bank yang tak mau layan saya...biasanya saya banyak soal, tapi duit tarak.- pada suatu ketika dulu, bini ada bawa leaflet bank tentang skim ini...kalau zaman tun, bonus dan dividen sampai 10-12% memang cantik...tolak bunga pinjaman skim asb, lebih bolih pakai.- kalau zaman..apa nama?...mana nama dia nie?...tak ada pula diblog?...oh ya...(datuk seri i mappadulung daeng mattimung karaeng sandrobone sultan abdul jalil) mohd najib abdul razak...mampus la bayar skim ini sebab pulangan asb tak cukup bayar hutang pinjaman.- saya masih ingat lagi dalam sekitar 1998 begitu, bila matawang kita jatuh masa "asian financial crisis", bunga naik 15%...banyak pelabur yang buat pinjaman bungkus...jadi bank punya non-performing loan...ratusan juta kena write-off...pinjaman habis begitu saja kena ambil bank sebagai cagaran untuk bayar principal.- sebaik2nya, melabur dalam skim asb ini berpandukan pada asas simpanan bulanan...atau kalau ada lebih wang...sikit sikit lama lama jadi bukit...ini la asas pelaburan yang baik.- pnb mesti hentikan pinjaman skim asb ini dengan serta merta sebab pinjaman ini tidak menguntungkan orang melayu...yang untung adalah bank2, bukan pelabur.

{acda.sulaiman@gmail.com} as salam datuk,baru baru ini dr m telah pun menyenarai kan (mungkin) sebahagian daripada manifesto pakatan harapan dan saya tertarik dengan manifesto tersebut. sebagai seorang pengundi saya bersedia memangkah pakatan harapan dalam pru 14 nanti sekiranya pakar pakar ekonomi pakatan harapan dapat memberi huraian secara lengkap keatas perkara perkara berikut yang kemungkinan pakatan harapan akan laksanakan sekiranya pakatan harapan menang dlm pru 14 nanti.huraian huraian nya mestilah di siarkan sebelum pru 14, bukan selepas nya. kenyataan saperti "huraian lengkap pelaksanaan akan di beri selepas pru 14" bukanlah jawapan yang dinanti nantikan.1. penghapusan gst.   sekiranya rejim pencukaian gst dihapuskan, apakah rejim pencukaian gantian yang akan dilaksanakan? adakah rejim pencukaian ini lebih rendah dari 6%. kalau lebih rendah dari 6%, adakah kerajaan ph akan mampu mengumpul pendapatan lebih tinggi berbanding dg gst bagi menampung perbelanjaan kerajaan termasuk pembangunan. bagaimana nak melaksanakan nya. 2. menstabilkan harga runcit minyak petrol.    harap huraikan bagaimana hendak melaksanakan nya kerana kita sedia maklum malaysia bukanlah negara pengeluar minyak utama dunia. harga minyak di pasaran malaysia terlalu bergantung kepada harga pasaran minyak dunia. penstabilan tersebut pula pada kadar berapa ringgit bagi setiap liter dan berapa lama pula boleh dikekalkan. 3. brim   adakan kerajaan ph akan mengekalkan skim ini atau akan dihapuskan. jika dikekalkan, mengapa? kalau hendak di hapuskan, akan adakah skim gantian dan bagaimana cara pelaksanaan nya. 4. ptptn   adakan skim ini akan dikekalkan, kalau dikekalkan, mengapa?jika dihapuskan, akan ada kah skim gantian? bagaimana hendak melaksanakan nya. sekiranya seluruh sistem pembelajaran pendidikan tinggi hendak dibiayai secara percuma pula, daripada sumber mana akan datang nya sumber kewangan yang besar untuk subjek ini.5. bagaimana hendak menstabilkan harga harga barangan keperluan harian saperti gula, tepong, minyak masak, gandum, susu, bawang dan beras. kita sedia maklum sebahagian daripada barangan ini di import sepenuhnya. pada harga harga berapa kah barangan ini hendak distabilkan. diharap dapat memberi jawapan yang ikhlas,jelas dan munasabah kerana isu isu diatas memberi impak secara terus keatas rakyat. sekian, terima kasih.

{a kadir jasin} berikut adalah jawapan (tan sri datuk seri) abdul wahid omar kepada tulisan saya. saya siarkan penuh dan tanpa suntingan.bhg1â€œassalamualaikum wbt & salam sejahtera,saya dengan segala hormatnya merujuk kepada tampalan blog ybhg datuk a kadir jasin 8 julai 2017 berkenaan pembidaan nombor pendaftaran kenderaan siri pnb. izinkan saya memberikan pencerahan berkenaan isu yang disebutkan.1. sebagai seorang ahli korporat, saya percaya bahawa penjenamaan korporat itu adalah penting untuk memperkukuhkan penambahbaikan secara fundamental sesebuah organisasi. ini berdasarkan prinsip atau falsafah "form without substance will not get you anywhere. but when you combine form with substance, you will go a long way". falsafah korporat ini telah saya laksanakan dengan jayanya semasa menerajui kumpulan uem-renong (2001-2004), telekom malaysia (2004-2008) dan maybank (2008-2013).2. saya berbesar hati kerana telah diberi kepercayaan untuk menerajui kumpulan pnb sebagai pengerusi kumpulan pada 1 ogos 2016. saya dan dato' abdul rahman ahmad yang telah dilantik sebagai presiden & ketua eksekutif kumpulan telah membentangkan pelan strategik pnb 2017-2022 pada 26 november 2016. pelan ini mensasarkan pnb menjadi sebuah firma pelaburan distinktif bertaraf dunia dengan 3 teras strategi utama iaitu i. meningkatkan pulangan secara mapan; ii. memacu kecemerlangan operasi dan iii. pengurusan pelaburan berkesan . pasukan pnb sedang giat melaksanakan pelan strategik ini dan alhamdulillah, reaksi awal pasaran amat memberangsangkan dimana nilai pasaran 6 syarikat-syarikat strategik pnb telah meningkat sebanyak rm31 bilion untuk 6 bulan pertama 2017. pasukan pnb juga telah berjaya melaksanakan migrasi sistem teknologi maklumat (it) semasa cuti hari raya aidilfitri baru-baru ini yang membolehkan transaksi unit saham amanah asb/asn, dll dilakukan tanpa menggunakan buku simpanan lagi. ini telah memudahkan lagi pelabur untuk berurusan dengan asnb.3. pnb telah ditubuhkan pada tahun 1978 dan bakal menyambut ulangtahun ke 40 pada tahun hadapan 2018. kami sedang dalam perancangan untuk memperkukuhkan jenama pnb. kebetulan siri nombor kenderaan "pnb" ditawarkan oleh jpj untuk bidaan pada bulan april 2017. kami telah memohon daripada menteri pengangkutan supaya 25 siri nombor pnb (1,2,3,8,10,11,18,20,30,50,60,70,80,90,100,111,118,200,300,400,500,600,700, 800 & 900) dikhususkan kepada pnb tanpa pembidaan. walaubagaimanapun kami telah diminta oleh jpj untuk membida nombor-nombor tersebut seperti umum. jumlah bidaan adalah rm336,059 berdasarkan purata bidaan nombor siri pmy,pmx dan pmw. ia telah ditingkatkan kepada rm419,006 untuk memastikan pnb mendapat kesemua 25 siri nombor tersebut (purata rm16,760 untuk satu nombor). nombor-nombor tersebut adalah untuk kegunaan kenderaan-kenderaan rasmi kumpulan pnb termasuk cawangan asnb bergerak, kenderaan hotel-hotel pnb perdana, pnb merdeka 118, dll. [bersambung]

{a kadir jasin} bhg2â€œ4. kami membuat keputusan berdasarkan apa yang kami fikir terbaik untuk pnb dalam jangkamasa panjang. nombor-nombor tersebut bakal menjadi aset jenama pnb dan pembayarannya dibuat secara langsung kepada jpj tanpa melalui mana-mana agen atau pihak ketiga. untuk makluman, dana rm419,006 datangnya dari dana milik pnb yang berjumlah rm40 bilion bukan dari dana milik pelabur-pelabur asnb yang berjumlah rm226 bilion. jadi, pembelian nombor-nombor tersebut tidak akan menjejaskan pulangan kepada pelabur-pelabur sama sekali.5. untuk pengetahuan, alhamdulillah saya selesa menggunakan kereta nasional proton perdana sebagai kereta rasmi dengan nombor pendaftaran w8d. nombor tersebut adalah satu manfaat yang saya perolehi semasa berkhidmat sebagai menteri di jabatan perdana menteri (2013-2016). sebagai seorang daripada keluarga miskin yang telah diberikan pendidikan dan biasiswa di bawah dasar ekonomi baru, saya amat terhutang budi kepada kerajaan dan negara malaysia. sebab itulah saya bersedia berkhidmat selama satu penggal dan membuat yang terbaik mengikut kemampuan saya.6. saya bersama-sama ahli-ahli lembaga pengarah pnb, dato' rahman dan barisan pengurusan pnb akan terus menjalankan amanah yang telah diberikan kepada kami demi kepentingan pnb, 13 juta pelabur-pelabur asnb dan negara kita malaysia. sokongan berterusan rakan-rakan semua amat kami hargai.terima kasih & salam hormat.awo. 08.07.17.â€?

{lee watt} datuk, interesting article from the malaysian insight today:prime minister najib razak has attacked dr mahathir mohamad for bank negara malaysia's forex losses, malaysia airlines' perennial woes and all the other ills visited upon malaysia during the latter's years in power.but where was najib during this period? he was a senior member of the cabinet, happily and merrily endorsing and supporting all the plans of dr mahathir.                        did he voice out his concerns all those times when the cabinet made or endorsed the decisions on bank negara's losses or malaysia airlines' privatisation, subsequent bailout, getting new management and schemes to keep the flag carrier in the sky?did he oppose anything at all during the mahathir administration? doesn't najib also have some culpability for the decimation of our institutions, the decades of corruption and thievery and the scandals galore that he now points at dr mahathir?  lest we forget, najib was the umno politician who chose dr mahathir over tengku razaleigh hamzah, and helped change the party history, and by extension the barisan nasional (bn) government and the country.there is little doubt that dr mahathir has much to answer for, from ops lalang to the hollowing of the malaysian judiciary, privatisation failures, etc.                        but he was ably assisted by his ministers and political warlords from july 1981 to october 31, 2003. of this group, najib was a major player through the years, be it in umno and in government.so, he can't feign ignorance and put the blame squarely on dr mahathir for all the decisions that has cost malaysia so much, from the economy to our rights and personal liberty.he can't point the finger at dr mahathir without pointing at himself. he was part and parcel of the government and the system that led to bank negara's losses, malaysia airlines' red ink then and now, and other scandals.after all, najib has his own issues now, such as the 1malaysia development berhad (1mdb) debts, losses and scandal which surely he cannot blame dr mahathir even if he tried.that is the elephant in the room that he and malaysia has to deal with now, not the saga of malaysia airlines' fortunes. lest we forget. â€“ july 10, 2017.

{nizambakar} in malaysia, the ground is so very fertile. people are angry. rural or urban. it is now the oppositionâ€™s task to accentuate the anger to action by strategic narratives through strategic mediums that will inspire the voters to vote bn out.it is clear that abdullah badawi and najib razakâ€™s joint mismanagement over the last fourteen years and counting has led to what economists like professor ks jomo have called â€œpiratisationâ€?.how long can malaysians tolerate the extent to which this country has been ransacked and pillaged? the financial bleeding has been non-stop since october 2002 when dr mahathir mohamad left the government with a surplus budget.of the 119 rural constituencies in malaysia, almost all are semi-rural too. they are within two hours away from a boat, bus or train ride to a major city or centre. indeed, 75% of the malaysian economy is driven by the economies of kuala lumpur, selangor and penang alone.the workers in kuala lumpur, selangor and penang may not have come across a party candidate from ppbm. they may not even have heard of syed saddiq syed abdul rahman, a top passionate debater, let alone myself.but they have heard of the power of the three ms in the form of mahathir, muhyiddin and mukhriz! and all three of them have trudged through all 119 constituencies in malaysia at one stage or another.and all three ms have never dragged the name of malaysia through the mud, as najib and his cabinet did. indeed, of the whole cabinet, only ahmad husni, the second finance minister, has had the conviction to resign.if the global electoral patterns are telling malaysia anything, it is that those who have the courage â€“ despite no party structures â€“ will win.indeed, of the three million members that are ostensibly in umno, throughout the general election in 2008, and again in 2013, hardly more than 1.1 million umno members cared to vote at all. that leaves 1.9 million umno members free to vote for ppbm too.with at least 1.9 million disgruntled umno members, plus another 30% from the 1.1 million members in umno, ppbm has the ability to cross the two million threshold of the rural village votes in peninsular malaysia, with the hope that sabah will likewise do the same through parti warisan sabah, led by former umno stalwart shafie apdal charging from the rural heartland.- rais husindatuk,the logic is correct.but where is the action?and where is the youth energy?pru14 will be about the younger voters.

{shahril} dato, while awaiting nervously for the outcome of our concerns, i would just like to add my views on sukasamasuka's and nizambakar's latest comments. on the " online and without passbook " system being introduced, i share the worries being expressed. this is because the post office, the tabung haji and the amanah saham nasional savings systems were manipulated to the loss of the depositors, more so at the initial stages. of course the depositors' plights never reached the public's ears.... all because complaints were individually made and the depositors lacked clear proof or were at a loss on how to pursue the matter. deposits in cash were acknowledged in the passbooks, but the cash and related official copy of deposit slips did not at times reach the final destinations. deposits received thru cheques were not meant to be credited until collected, but sometimes totally lost their ways somewhere else. i am not sure how the weaknesses were overcome in posb and th. but, as regards asn accounts, complaints of  losses were a concern in the 80's in the bank i worked and certain officers were put on the alert lists in connection therewith. all this happened despite the use of passbooks. the problem only found some solace when the system was subsequently improved with the dual use of " on-line update " in addition to the traditional use of passbook. i admit that i'v not familiarize myself with the new " on-line without passbook " system. be that as it may, i am gravely nervous about it, if the passbook is done away with. as regards pnb's extravagance as raise by nizambakar, i too have suspected something odd. tun ismail was frugal with staff expenses when he was bnm chief, although glimpses did indicate he cultivated a class of his own living complete with fine sets of cutlery and cigars. my suspicion in fact started with the golden handshake he extended to khalid. question did linger in my mind as to what he would get for himself. since there was no way for me to check on that, i had contented myself to leave it at that. but, now with nizambakar's revelations, things ought to be given a second look. as suggested, pnb are in position to give much higher returns. the special allocations they get in ipo's itself should have been able to make every malay family a millionaire by now. salam.

{zed-85} sallam dato’saya agak musykil, harta-harta yang disebutkan oleh doj dalam berita antaranya, diamond (intan) pink diamond bernilai us27 juta.kebiasaannya, intan/diamond berwarna putih. belum pernah saya tengok diamond di kedai habib jewel yang berwarna “pink” atau merah jambu.rupa-rupanya, intan berwarna “pink” ini terjadi disebabkan tekanan yang luar biasa dalam bumi “seismic event” disebabkan gemba bumi atau letupan gunung berapi.akibat dari tekanan yang luar biasa, struktur dalaman intan berubah dan mengeluarkan warna “pink” atau merah jambu.mengikut berita, jho low order intan “pink heart diamond” dengan warna “vivid” atau “slighly short of vivid”.  warna pink yang lebih gelap atau “vivid”, nilainya lebih tinggi dari warna pink yang cair atau kurang gelap (less vivid).selepas ini, kalau ada orang kampong yang hendak meminang atau hendak berkahwin, boleh buat hantaran “pink diamond” yang warnanya “vivid”.harganya mengikut media semasa sekitar us27 juta atau lebih kurang rm120 juta.kita boleh ambil nasihat datin rosmah supaya bertabung dari kecil untuk kumpul duit. katanya, hari raya jangan membazir, beli baju raya 2 pasang sudah cukup. jangan ambil peduli promosi baju raya dekat dalam tv.bila cukup duit , bolehlah beli “pink diamond” yang berbentuk “heart” atau hati.pepatah orang putih kata “diamond are forever”

{zed-85} saudara rengas berkah,parti bersatu tidak akan keluar dari pakatan.konsep “the best man win” adalah praktikal dalam pertandingan karate atau tae kwan do.kalau main bolasepak, pasukan yang menang adalah yang dapat score “gol” paling banyak. tendang palang gol tak kira, offside pun tak kira.kita amalkan sistem demokrasi yang diwarisi dari british.dalam sistem demokrasi, hanya parti atau gabungan parti yang mendapat undi (“vote”) paling banyak dalam pilihanraya akan menang.setiap undi rakyat malaysia, tidak kira orang melayu, cina, india, dikira sebagai satu undi.oleh itu sudah tentu jumlah undi pakatan harapan akan lebih banyak dari jumlah undi satu parti ppbm.umno pun tidak akan keluar dari bn kerana jumlah undi umno tak cukup untuk bentuk kerajaan.semasa perang dunia kedua, kalau satu negara britain saja hendak lawan jerman pun tak boleh menang. mereka bergabung dengan amerika dan akhirnya terpaksa begabung dengan komunis rusia untuk tumbangkan nazi.pendek kata (bottom line), sekiranya pembangkang hendak menumbangkan bn. pembangkang mesti atau wajib bergabung supaya mendapat undi paling banyak.

{rengas berkah} saudara zed-85. apa kena mengena taek kwan do, karate atau bola sepak dengan pilihan raya? analogi yang jauh tersasar. sistem pilihan raya di malaysia tidak pernah kira jumlah undi untuk membentuk kerajaan, tetapi jumlah kerusi. first past the post system. parti atau gabungan parti yang terlebih dahulu dapat memenangi jumlah kerusi yang mencukupi untuk membentuk kerajaan maka parti itu atau gabungan parti itu berhak untuk menghadap ydpa agong untuk membentuk kerajaan. kalau menang paling banyak undi pun tapi jumlah kerusi tak cukup tak boleh bentuk kerajaan jugak. macam pakatan harapan pada pru-13 yang menang undi popular sebanyak 51 peratus, tak boleh bentuk kerajaan jugak pasal jumlah kerusi yang mereka menangi tak cukup untuk membentuk kerajaan. siapa kata tanpa ph, bersatu tak boleh bentuk kerajaan? kalau bersatu bertanding lebih banyak kerusi daripada parti-parti dalam ph dan menang lebih banyak kerusi daripada parti-parti dalam ph, bersatu akan dikira sebagai parti yang paling dominan. parti yang paling banyak menang kerusi. walaupun masih tak cukup jumlah kerusi untuk membentuk sesebuah kerajaan, bersatu boleh bertindak dengan 'woo other party' atau parties untuk membentuk kerajaan perpaduan. seperti yang berlaku pada pilihan raya umum tahun 2009 di britain di mana berlaku 'hung parliament'. parti buruh dan konservatif masing-masing tidak mampu untuk membentuk kerajaan kerana masing-masing masih kekurangan kerusi untuk membentuk majority. akhirnya parti konservatif bawah pimpinan david cameron berjaya membentuk kerajaan campuran apabila bergabung dengan parti liberal democratic, parti yang lebih kecil bawah bawah pimpinan nick clegg. dengan terbentuknya kerajaan, david cameron menjawat jawatan perdana menteri dan nick clegg dilantik tpm. itulah sistem demokrasi berparlimen yang diamalkan di britain dan diamalkan juga disini.

intelligent one.interesting take from en. farouk peru:"politik timur tengah sentiasa bermasalah. walaupun umat islam adalah majoriti, konsep kesatuan islam hanya tinggal slogan sahaja. bangsa arab bermusuhan sesama sendiri, memutuskan persahabatan dengan alasan nipis dan berperang tanpa belas kasihan.tetapi, orang melayu islam beria-ia mentaksubkan diri mereka kepada bangsa arab. mereka setia kepada negara seperti arab saudi sampai mereka terus menikus apabila negara itu melanggar hak-hak asasi manusia.sepatutnya, umat islam yang paling lantang bersuara apabila kezaliman berlaku tetapi oleh kerana sebab tertentu, agamawan melayu islam pun terdiam seribu bahasa.hanya beberapa hari lepas, beberapa negara arab seperti arab saudi, bahrain, emiriyah arab bersatu, mesir, libya dan yaman memutuskan hubungan diplomatik dengan qatar, satu negara kecil di semenanjung arab. alasannya ialah qatar menyokong beberapa kumpulan pengganas, dan menamakan kumpulan seperti ikhwan al-muslimin, al-qaeda, is dan sebagainya.tindakan arab saudi ini boleh diungkapkan dengen peribahasa melayu, mengata dulang, paku serpih. mengata orang, dia yang lebih!pada zahirnya, arab saudi tidaklah menyokong mana-mana gerakan teroris. masalah utama dengan arab saudi ialah ideologi yang didukungnya iaitu wahabisme.wahabisme sudah lama meresap masuk ke dalam dna islam dunia melayu. pada mulanya, kita tidak dapat menangkap ajaran wahabi.saya meminati bidang ini sejak awal zaman 90an dan memang tidak asing kepada pusat buku islam di lembah klang. tetapi saya tidak pernah nampak pemikiran yang seperti aliran wahabi. jadi dalam taksiran saya, gerakan ini telah menular mungkin hanya 20 tahun yang lampau.satu sebab utama gerakan ini tidak jelas ialah mereka tidak akan menggunakan nama wahabib (atau nama lain sekarang, “pak wahab”!). malah nama yang dipakai sesama mereka pun, “salaf as-salih” (pengikut generasi pertama islam), tidak biasa dipakai kerana akan dapat dikesan orang ramai.sebaliknya, mereka menggunakan nama ahlus sunnah wal jamaah sahaja walaupun mereka banyak mengkafirkan golongan tersebut.wahabisme ini bukan mazhab mahu pun puak seperti mana sunni atau syiah. ia adalah satu aliran pemikiran yang sukar kita nampak dan saya akan menerangkan sebab-sebabnya di bawah."see:http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/opinion/2017/06/14/qatar-saudi-dan-kemaraan-pak-wahab-di-malaysia/do not assume that saudis are solving problems, without seeing their other motives.

"mereka (arab sebelum islam) menanam hidup-hidup anak-anak perempuan mereka."- kalau di negara2 islam, terutama sekali di malaysia, isu buang bayi berleluasa, aku rasa dinegara2 kafir tentu mereka lagi zalim...aku pernah terdengar bahawa orang kafir suka makan daging baby sausage ...ish! ish! ish!- kabilah2 arab yang menang perang bukan suka dengan janda arab, jadi yang tinggal hanya la anak2 perempuan.jadi bapa2 arab, mungkin lagi baik dia "tanam hidup2" anak2 perempuan mereka...atau "sembunyi dalam lubang hidup2" macam saddam hussein...daripada dijadikan hamba2 seks.nota: istilah "anak2 perempuan" bukan sama dengan "bayi2 perempuan"...anak2 perempuan makna nya sudah jadi perempuan.- kalau kita tinjau sejarah silam, adakah orang2 asal yang beragama hindu, buddha dan pagan..sebelum adanya "malaysia" dan "melayu"...yang jadi penghuni wilayah2 di "tanah melayu" semenanjung, sabah dan sarawak ini, ada permasaalahan yang serupa?atau, masaalah ini timbul hanya bila islam itu mula masuk ke wilayah2 ini saja,  macam di zaman arab jahiliyah dahulu?kena tanya dengan zakir naik sebab dia pakar agama2 hindu, buddha dsbnya.- lagi satu, sebelum aku lupa, bukan akhlak semua suku2 kaum arab "tanam hidup-hidup anak-anak perempuan mereka".“sebaik-baik perempuan arab ialah perempuan quraisy. mereka sangat penyayang terhadap anak-anak yatim sewaktu kecilnya dan mereka amat menjaga kedudukan dan harta benda suami.” (sahih muslim, jilid 16 ms. 81)ini bukti sejarah dalam hadis...kalau hadis itu bolih digunakan sebagai bahan ilmiah sejarah...yang arab quraisy tidak ada adat yang sedemikian rupa sebab "penyayang" itu sudah cukup membuktikan akhlak mereka.nota lagi: bahasa seni seperti peribahasa melayu bukan senang mau diterjemahkan, contohnya,anak kera di hutan disusui, anak sendiri di rumah mati kebuluran.orang inggeris fikir, lebih kurang 1,400 tahun yang lalu, perempuan asal orang borneo nie jahil sampai sanggup masuk dalam hutan kasi susu anak kera...padahal hutan itu ialah rumah orang utan.begitu la juga bahasa al quran...ianya bukan buku ilmu sejarah, walaupun ada unsur2 sejarah.

{zalman a} datuk,the 24-hour replacement still ignores mo1's sins:the united states department of justice (doj) may have finally shed light on what happened to the us$620 million that “malaysian official 1” (mo1) had returned to his "donor".in a latest civil forfeiture suit filing, the doj alleged that at least us$27.3 million was used to buy a 22-carat pink diamond pendant and necklace for “mo1's wife.”on june 2013, two months before the sum was returned, the doj said low had contacted jeweller lorraine schwartz, asking urgently for a diamond necklace with a "18 carrot (sic) pink heart diamond".the next month, schwartz travelled to monaco with a 22-carat pink diamond, to meet low as well as then aabar chief executive officer mohamed ahmed badawy al-husseiny aboard a yacht.also on board the yacht were the wife of mo1, and her friend - dubbed by the doj as "malaysian friend".on the yacht, the group purportedly discussed the design of the necklace which would hold the pink diamond.according to the doj, schwartz's next encounter with mo1's wife was in new york on sept 28 to show a layout of the necklace's design.najib and his wife rosmah mansor were in new york at the time for the un general assembly. najib addressed the assembly on sept 28.besides the us$27.3 million pink diamond necklace, the doj also accused low of purchasing 27 different 18-carat gold necklaces and bracelets for mo1's wife, worth a total of us$1.3 million.in the month of ramadan he issues lies to cover this scandal.

{sukasamasuka} datuk,ini bukan pandangan saya tetapi yang berdasarkan fakta.1. fgv bukan sime darby.2. sime darby ialah sebuah conglomerate atas gabungan perladangan guthrie dan golden hope...ada syarikat2 lain lagi. ketiga2 company itu adalah asalnya british...diambil alih dari tangan british masa tun jadi pm dulu...jadi sime darby mungkin "masih british" dari segi pengurusannya.3. fgv 100% melayu umno...macam 1mdb...tidak ada apa2...berniaga atas angin saja...malahan ceo sime darby mohd bakke pun dari imdb juga.4. tujuan fgv ditubuhkan adalah untuk mengambil alih semua harta2 felda...tanah2 dan kilang2 untuk buat listing di bursa saham...cari capital lagi besar, konon nak kasi besar lagi business.tujuan 1mdb  pun sama juga, kaut hartanah dari kerajaan dengan harga murah, dinilai dan dijual dengan harga mahal. 5. kemana sudah duit felda dan fgv yang berbillion2 itu selepas listing, itu kena tanya isa samad (fgv) dan, sharir ahmad (felda)...dua2 ahli veteran politik umno yang korup.6. dari sini kita nampak perbezaan sime darby dan fgv...satu business perladangan, yang satu pula satu "vehicle" untuk najib dan isa samad "curi duit", sebiji macam 1mdb la.7. dimana salah satu buah company sime darby terlibat dengan project bakun dengan taib mahmud (orang kuat bn sarawak yang juga korup, tapi sekarang sudah jadi tyt la)...berbillion2 hilang itu duit...itu kena tanya musa hitam (ex chairman sime darby, musuh tun juga).8. semua pemegang saham besar dalam sime darby ada appointed directors mereka masing2...tetapi, felda yang jadi pemegang saham terbesar tidak ada directors mereka dalam fgv...tanya sharir ahmad...pelik tapi benar.9. jadi siapa yang buat keputusan dalam fgv?...isa samad dibawah arahan pm sendiri...kenapa saya berani cakap begini?contoh terbaik ialah bila najib bagi rm500 duit raya dari duit cukai rakyat.kalau duit rm500 itu dari bapa si najib atau dari felda atau dari fgv, aku tak kisah...tetapi, itu duit dari rakyat yang tidak ada kena mengena dengan urusan felda dan fgv.begitu la cara najib mengurus harta negara...macam duit bapa dia sendiri.10. olih yg demikian, harta fgv sudah merosot sebanyak rm10.5 billion sekarang...atas kertas...sebab pelabur2 sudah jual saham2 fgv yang tidak ada nilai lagi disebabkan kerugian fgv yang berbillion2 ringgit.11. fgv bukan sime darby...fgv berjiwakan melayu umno yang diketuai olih mo1...harap2 sime darby masih terus berjiwakan "british"...tetapi, kena juga awas2 sebab pengerusi sime darby aku dengar2 si abdul ghani othman...dia nie tukang cat rumah ke? atau loyar? atau tukang musik? mungkin doktor? jangan2 wartawan?12. ini aku dengar, mungkin tidak betul...ada "orang dalam" yang curi buah kelapa sawit di felda dengan sewenang2nya...tetapi, bukan orang umno ....bukan juga si najib sebab rosmah memasak lauk pakai minyak kelapa sawit dalam plastik.catitan orang kampung sahaja: semalam kami bergaduh di sebuah pasaraya kecil, mau beli minyak sawit 1kg dalam plastik...minyak subsidi...maklum la dekat raya...seorang dapat 2 plastik saja...aku, anak2, cucu2 dan bini kena berbaris mau dapatkan...tetapi cucu2 aku tak dapat sebab bawah umur...nenek durang {shah} cash is king....how our stolen 1mdb money is used.to issue cheques from mo1's ambank account.the pre-election cash bonanzas included a rm100,000,000 cheque handed to ‘pertubuhan kebangsaan malaya bersatu (umno)’ 11th april 2013 a week after the election had been announced.  on 22nd april umno malaysia again received two further cheques of rm50 million each.individual cheques were also handed out to all umno and related bn divisions, for example badan perhubungan umno negeri pahang received rm15 million on 18th april and the following day, april 19th, umno penang received rm5 million. kelantan division received rm5 million on 10th april.amongst the many other similar payments was rm5 million both the umno state party of kedah and the mca selangor liason committee on 8th april and rm20 million to umno selangor on april 24th.  umno perak received its handout on april 29th of rm25 million with another five million each going to umno selangor and the mca selangor liason committee again the following day.  also on 30th april johor umno received rm25 million, less than a week before the election.the umno womens’ divisions also received significant pay outs, signifying the party’s appreciation of the importance of ‘winning’ the female vote: pergerakan puteri umno malaysia received a rm5 million cheque 27th february and pergerakan wanita umno selangor rm1.1 million 22nd march and wanita barisan nasional selangor rm1 million on 17th may.allied parties also received big money, for example the liberal democratic party received rm1 million 5th april, the malaysian indian congress received rm10 million on the 18th april and a further rm5 million 26th april. supp received rm2 million 20th march.  the previous year upco had received rm2 million, indeed over the election huge sums were dished out to sabah and particularly sarawak (of which more later).saudi storysince all this money came from stolen public funds, borrowed at punishing rates of interest under false pretenses, the ultimate cost to the malaysian taxpayer will be at least double the sums handed out in this exercise to buy votes for the ruling party, who was abusing its position in such a spectacular fashion.people are entitled to assume that a man who is willing to raid his country’s development fund, as well as the civil servant pension fund, the pilgrims’ fund, the farmers’ fund and doubtless other sources of public money, is unlikely to hesitate to attempt to bribe voters with a little of that money back in the form of payment for votes.

{john doe} terima kasih dakj kerana respon kpd komen saya. saya mohon izin untuk membuat sedikit penambahan dan pecerahan. apabila saya sebut kena siasat tentang kemanakah wang sebesar itu pergi dari akaun shafie saya tidak meletakkan apa-apa sempadan 'kes tertentu yang diwakili' oleh shafie. 'wang berkuasa menentukan keputusan' tidak hanya merujuk kepada keputusan hakim di mahkamah selepas berlaku pendakwaan, tetapi merangkumi semua keputusan yang lain daripada polis, koroner, agensi penyiasatan yang lain seperti sprm dan agensi dalam negeri yang lain seperti imigresen, kastam dsbgnya. sebab itu komen awal saya dibuat secara terbuka dan tidak menjurus semata-mata kepada keputusan penghakiman. dari sudut ilmu psikologi, manusia akan lebih 'bermurah hati' apabila 'melarikan diri' berbanding apabila 'berburu'. rm9.5j adalah 'luar biasa murah hati'. saya lebih cenderung untuk mempercayai ia adalah fee dan 'kos-kos' lain bagi seseorang yang sedang melarikan diri berbanding seseorang yang sedang berburu. bandingkan jumlah ini dengan pengakuan salehudin saidin yg yuran guamannya hanya ratusan ribu ringgit. apakah shafie ini luar biasa hebat berbanding salehudin? kenapa jauh sangat beza yuran guaman keduanya? takkanlah nak sabitkan anwar sehingga perlukan rm9.5j. sejujurnya saya percaya ramai lagi mampu buat kerja itu dgn baik untuk fee ratusan ribu seperti yang diterima salehudin.malah mengambil kira pengalaman 'mensabitkan' seseorang tertuduh, salehudin jauh lebih berpengalaman daripada shafie. maka yuran luar biasa hebat ini sudah tentu bukan sekdar bayaran untuk 'kemampuan' (ability) dan pengalaman (experience) tetapi juga bayaran untuk 'kesanggupan'. di dalam kes shafie vs anwar, ia adalah kes berburu bagi najib. apa kata kita buang segala sempadan dan berfikir seperti seorang yang sedang terdesak  untuk melarikan diri. mari kita lihat pula kes-kes di mana kelibat shafie kelihatan muncul sama ada di mahkamah, tempat kejadian, hospital dll. contohnya kes altantuya dan najdi. malahan kalau boleh korek, korek juga kes morais sama ada kelibat shafie telah muncul di mana-mana tempat sepanjang kronologi kes berlaku. adalah amat tidak mustahil dan amatlah berkemungkinan benar bagi mereka yang meminati siri 'criminal minds' bahawasanya rm9.5j ini bukan untuk 'memburu anwar' tapi untuk membantu sesorang 'melarikan diri daripada diburu'. ada pula road show yang mana shafie terlibat di dalam sesi penerangan tentang kes anwar hanyalah bernilai 'servis tambahan' di dalam pakej melarikan diri yang disediakan. ini bukan menuduh tetapi hanyalah 'follow the leads' daripada kaedah 'analyzing human behaviour'. siasat, siasat dan siasat. kelak jawapan akan ditemui, in shaa allah. wallahu a'lam.

{shah} musa hassan deflection fails:"imagine holding a press conference to make a loud statement to the media about something that is not directly related to yourself, when you haven’t even thoroughly checked the facts.this is what musa hassan, a former igp has done.  what a nightmare it must have been to work for someone that careless in a top position.if musa had properly examined the facts (read sarawak report for example) he would have noted that from day one we made clear that one of najib’s personal accounts (no 2112022009694), the one which received $681 million in march 2013, was closed the following august:however, our article about shafee’s payments quite clearly cites a later account najib opened, into which money from src international was paid (a subsidiary of 1mdb).this was account number 2112022011906, which remained open until we broke the scandal in 2015.  getting these sorts of details right are the bread and butter of investigative work and something this senior officer ought to have been taught in police college.it is lucky he is now retired and perhaps he should keep it that way, instead of digging his friends into deeper holes, when they themselves are plainly deciding that silence is the better option."

{zalman a} datuk,more foolishness:"a note from prison yesterday scuttled pakatan harapan’s presidential council meeting where the leaders were finalising its list of office bearers to be submitted to the registrar of societies. it was not an ordinary note. it came from the sungai buloh prison.the malaysian insight learnt that former anwar ibrahim, who is serving a five-year jail term for sodomy at sungai buloh prison, wanted to keep the original ph lineup, and this scuppered the opposition coalition’s plan to unveil its lineup yesterday.sources said while the majority of ph leaders had agreed to a new lineup which would see dr mahathir mohamad as chairman and dr wan azizah wan ismail as president, anwar in his note, insisted on the original lineup.in the original lineup, dr mahathir would be the advisor, while dr wan azizah would be the chairman. the three vice-chairman seats would be filled by muhyiddin yassin (bersatu), mohamad sabu (amanah) and lim guan eng (dap).bersatu had complained that this structure would mean that dr mahathir did not have any executive powers as the coalition’s advisor.“the meeting today was to discuss the proposal to appoint dr mahathir as the chairman and wan azizah as the president of ph.“but because of the note, the decision had to be postponed again,” the source told the malaysian insight."as i say, this drama pulls the teeth from the ph tiger even before it can bite.there is no sane person who regards wan azizah as a competent leader.anwar seems to want to ensure a mo! victory.the only faint hope that ph has is either dr m or perhaps azmin as pm-designate.any games by anwar are not helping now.

{zalman a} datuk,lying to parliament is a serious matter.it was said there that shafee was paid only rm1,000 for his services:"it raises some extraordinary issues, because back in 2014 the public was told to believe that this high-powered barrister, a known favourite of the najib administration, had conducted the entire appeal prosecution against anwar for a paltry sum of just rm1,000 (us$230 at present rates).this was the sum that nancy shukri, a minister in the prime minister’s office, provided to parliament when questioned on this very matter, owing to the unusual nature of shafee’s appointment to a job that would normally have been done by members of the public prosecution service.the opposition parties had suspected that shafee must have been paid far above the normal rates at public expense to conduct the appeal and then to further take the case through the federal court.  however, shukri stunned them with the opposite information.in an extraordinary statement she said that the government had made an exception to normal rules of privacy in this case, in order to disclose the miscroscopic fee.  in fact, the minster added, shafee had wanted to do the job for nothing at all, hence the token payment. “we wanted to be transparent” she said."this matter cannot be allowed to rest.why was shafee given so many millions?where did the money go?who was it given to?

{sukasamasuka} datuk,kamil tajuddin 10.44 pm...*maka siapakah yang perlu bertanggungjawab kerana matawang ringgit terus merosot 65% dan tidak sekalipun mengukuh selama 22 tuhan mahathir menjawat perdana menteri?*1. tun yang harus bertanggungjawab pada masa itu dan kalau itu satu kesalahan maka tun harus dihadapkan ke mahkamah.2. salah satu sebab yang kita masih ingat kenapa ini berlaku mungkin ada dalam catatan ini....'the asian crisis was sparked in 1997 by a loss of confidence on the part of foreign investors. in malaysia the situation was dire. funds were pulled out of malaysian markets and investors speculated against the local currency, the ringgit. by september 1998, the local currency had fallen 40% from pre-crisis levels and $140 million had been wiped off the value of the stock market. as the currency slid, pressure increased to raise interest rates to try to keep money in the country. but higher interest rates hurt businesses. the malaysian economy contracted 2.8% in the first quarter of 1998. prime minister mahathir bin mohammed was enraged by the disruption to the country's recent history of steady economic growth and accused financier george soros, the jews and “rogue speculators” of trying to destroy malaysia's currency. he railed against the world financial order and said that countries that insulated themselves had a better chance of survival.calling for reform of the entire world financial system, mahathir imposed capital controls on september 1, 1998. the ringgit's value was fixed at 3.80 ringgit to the dollar (about 10% higher then where it was trading in the market at the time). all ringgit that had been taken out of the country was ordered to be repatriated by the end of the month—although that deadline was later extended. the government then imposed tight limits on transfers of capital abroad by residents in malaysia and froze all foreign portfolio investment (in stocks, bonds, etc.) from being taken out of the country for 12 months.' (1)2. the most famous advocate of capital controls for asia was massachusetts institute of technology economist paul krugman, who, in a widely-publicized article in fortune magazine, advised asia's leaders to take drastic action. “there is a virtual consensus among economists that exchange controls work badly,” krugman wrote in a piece entitled “saving asia: it's time to get radical” which ran on september 7, 1998. but “when you face the kind of disaster now occurring in asia, the question has to be: badly compared to what?” krugman asked. (1)(1) http://policydialogue.org/publications/backgrounders/casestudies/capital_controls_malaysia/

{zalman a} datuk,gerrymandering in full swing. do not forget who the ec works for:according to research by politweet, bn can win an additional 11 seats in the selangor state legislative assembly with the new boundaries proposed in september 2016. these 11 seats would be won with no changes in votes from ge13 but only through the shifting of voters to strategic seats for bn.similarly, in the september 2016 proposals for melaka, the seat of bukit baru, won by pakatan rakyat by 48 votes in ge13, would be won by bn with a 1,600-vote majority with the new boundaries. the marginal seat of telok mas, won by bn by just 700 votes in ge13, would become a safe seat with a 3,000-vote majority.worse still, based on the september 2016 proposal, the bukit katil federal seat, won by pakatan rakyat in ge13 by nearly 7,000 votes, would now be won by bn with a 4,800 vote majority. this move is especially suspicious, given that in august 2016, one month before the proposal became public, the melaka chief minister called for the ec to change bukit katil boundaries to make it easier for bn to win.the same pattern emerges throughout the country. in perak, the safe pakatan rakyat seats in ge13 of changkat jering and sungai rapat would be won by bn, with no change in votes. in kuala lumpur, nurul izzah anwar would lose the seat of lembah pantai.http://www.themalaymailonline.com/what-you-think/article/the-new-election-boundaries-where-ge14-will-be-won-or-lost-zoe-randhawathere is merit in having a snap election in selangor soon.at least retain that before the ec's cheating takes hold.
